document_data.mainbody: '''Matthew Hopkins''' was an eccentric but well-respected [[necromancer]], member of the [[Ministry of Art]] in the late 14{{th}} century [[DR]].{{Cite organized play/LC/A Boy and His Mammoth|9-10}}
document_data.Description: In the 1370s DR, Matthew was an older man whose mental capacities were diminished with age and made him prone to fits of frustrated rage. He was a white-haired man in his 70s.
document_data.Abilities: Matthew kept two active protective [[spell]]s cast on himself most of the time: ''[[armor (spell)|armor]]'' and ''[[stoneskin]]''. Because of his lunacy, any attempts to use the ''[[ESP]]'' magic on him rendered the casters prone to be paralyzed and curled up in the fetal position, overwhelmed by his mind.
